alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Talbot; Taylor; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 3:41AM EDT until March 30 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at GA 26 near Montezuma affecting Macon, Dooly and Sumter Counties. Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Upson, Crawford, Talbot and Taylor Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Bleckley and Pulaski Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Jones, Monroe, Bibb and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River at Dublin affecting Washington, Laurens, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20 feet, Minor flooding continues along the river in the woodlands and fields upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 19. The flood waters will cover the boat ramp up to two feet deep and cover a portion of the access road by the bridge on the Taylor County side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EDT Thursday was 28.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 4.7 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.2 feet on 09/17/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
